Q1. [TRUE/FALSE] Public-key cryptography is generally faster than symmetric encryption for encrypting large amounts of data.
Answer: False

Q2. [SINGLE CORRECT] Which of the following is a primary strength of public-key cryptography compared to symmetric encryption?
A) Faster encryption/decryption speeds for bulk data.
B) Simpler key management, as only one key needs to be managed per communication.
C) Easier key distribution, as the encryption key can be publicly shared.
